segments.title: To be or not to be
segments.source: Branagh's uncut Hamlet is 242 minutes. Act 3 Scene 1 at approximately 45% runtime places it around 1:48:54. Famous mirror/hall scene with slow camera zoom.
segments.notes: Film runtime 242 minutes (4h02m). Shot in hall of mirrors. Branagh delivers in slow whisper.

segments.title: To be or not to be
segments.source: Olivier's Hamlet is 155 minutes (Part 1: 99 min, Part 2: 56 min). Act 3 Scene 1 at ~45% runtime places it around 1:09:45. Set on the castle tower from opening.
segments.notes: Film runtime 155 minutes. Soliloquy comes after the 'get thee to a nunnery' confrontation in Olivier's staging.

segments.title: To be or not to be
segments.source: BBC 1980 Hamlet total runtime of 212 minutes. Act 3 Scene 1 typically occurs around 45% through the play, placing it approximately at 1:35:24.
segments.notes: Total film runtime 212 minutes (3h32m). Patrick Stewart appears as Claudius.

segments.title: Tomorrow and tomorrow and tomorrow
segments.source: RSC Macbeth is 145 minutes. Act 5 Scene 5 at ~88% runtime places it around 2:07:36. McKellen's famous delivery in intimate black-box staging.
segments.notes: Film runtime 145 minutes. Directed by Trevor Nunn with Judi Dench as Lady Macbeth.

segments.title: Tomorrow and tomorrow and tomorrow
segments.source: Act 5 Scene 5 occurs near the end of the 159-minute film. Estimated at approximately 2:20:00 based on play structure.
segments.notes: Total film runtime 159 minutes. Scene follows Lady Macbeth's death announcement.

segments.title: Is this a dagger which I see before me
segments.source: RSC Macbeth is 145 minutes. Act 2 Scene 1 at ~28% runtime places it around 40:36. Intimate close-up staging with McKellen.
segments.notes: Film runtime 145 minutes. Trevor Nunn's black-box staging emphasizes psychological intensity.

segments.title: Is this a dagger which I see before me
segments.source: Academic analysis confirms scene occurs at 38:27-38:36 mark, with the full dagger speech running 3:45 in length.
segments.notes: Stewart delivers this in one prolonged take. Act 2 Scene 1. Full speech approximately 3:45 duration.

segments.title: All the world's a stage
segments.source: As You Like It 1936 is 96 minutes. Act 2 Scene 7 at ~40% runtime places it around 38:24. Olivier's first Shakespeare film.
segments.notes: Film runtime 96 minutes. The 'Seven Ages of Man' speech was retained in full despite other cuts.

segments.title: All the world's a stage
segments.source: YouTube clip - standalone performance of the soliloquy.
segments.notes: Benedict Cumberbatch performs Jacques' Seven Ages of Man speech from As You Like It.

segments.title: Now is the winter of our discontent
segments.source: As You Like It 1936 is 96 minutes. Act 2 Scene 7 at ~40% runtime places it around 38:24. Olivier's first Shakespeare film.
segments.notes: Film runtime 96 minutes. The 'Seven Ages of Man' speech was retained in full despite other cuts.

segments.title: Now is the winter of our discontent
segments.source: Audio highlights recording. Opening soliloquy likely at the beginning of the highlights reel. Original film soliloquy shot in one 9-minute take.
segments.notes: Audio recording from the 1955 film. Olivier extended speech with lines from Henry VI Part 3.

segments.title: Once more unto the breach
segments.source: Henry V 1944 is 137 minutes. Act 3 Scene 1 at ~35% runtime places it around 47:57. Battle of Harfleur siege scene.
segments.notes: Film runtime 137 minutes. Famous transition from Globe Theatre staging to realistic battle scenes.

segments.title: Once more unto the breach
segments.source: Web research confirms scene appears at timestamp 00:43:49 in Branagh's 1989 Henry V film.
segments.notes: Film runtime 137 minutes. Branagh's breakthrough Shakespeare film, muddy and visceral Harfleur siege.

segments.title: O what a rogue and peasant slave am I
segments.source: Branagh's Hamlet is 242 minutes. Act 2 Scene 2 at ~30% runtime places it around 1:12:36. Delivered with mounting anger.
segments.notes: Film runtime 242 minutes. Branagh delivers with mounting anger rather than bewilderment.

segments.title: O what a rogue and peasant slave am I
segments.source: Olivier's Hamlet is 155 minutes. Act 2 Scene 2 at ~30% runtime places it around 46:30.

segments.title: O what a rogue and peasant slave am I
segments.source: BBC 1980 Hamlet is 212 minutes. Act 2 Scene 2 at ~30% runtime places it around 1:03:36.
segments.notes: Film runtime 212 minutes. Full uncut BBC Television Shakespeare production.

segments.title: But soft, what light through yonder window breaks
segments.source: Zeffirelli's Romeo and Juliet is 138 minutes. Act 2 Scene 2 (balcony scene) at ~25% runtime places it around 34:30.
segments.notes: Film runtime 138 minutes. Famous balcony scene with Leonard Whiting and Olivia Hussey.

metadata.researchNotes: Timestamps gathered from web research. 'verified' confidence means specific timestamps were found in academic or production sources. 'estimated' means calculated based on play structure and known film runtimes.

estimationMethod.once-more-unto-the-breach: Act 3 Scene 1 - approximately 35% into Henry V
estimationMethod.all-the-worlds-a-stage: Act 2 Scene 7 - approximately 40% into As You Like It
estimationMethod.but-soft-what-light: Act 2 Scene 2 - approximately 25% into Romeo and Juliet
estimationMethod.now-is-the-winter: Act 1 Scene 1 - opening of Richard III

sources: scalar.usc.edu - Henry V film analysis with Branagh timestamp (00:43:49)
ecampusontario.pressbooks.pub - Goold Macbeth analysis with timestamps
